body_html: Can you try storing the dataset as something else than a pandas data frame (numpy array perhaps)? I suspect that this is caused by treating the memory as copy-on-write after fork. Pandas might be mutating some memory that's interspersed with your data (e.g. Python refcounts), causing every process to progressively break sharing and get its own copies.
